name: TheAtlantic
text: Once a COVID-19 vaccine is approved, federal and state governments still have to distribute it. And a whole new round of trouble could start, reports @sarahzhang: https://t.co/W9IuPWnrSf

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When you look at how many people vote in general elections, it's just not enough. There's no way that government can work properly if it can't accurately reflect who we are as a nation." The actor @ChrisEvans on the inspiration for @ASP: https://t.co/LYfiZbmYqK #TheAtlanticFest https://t.co/iw0hrTelrk

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Two proposals are gaining momentum among commentators and progressive activists: expanding the number of justices and instituting term limits. These ideas almost always seem to smack of political revenge," Lawrence Goldstone writes: https://t.co/7yh6aIdzMx

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @mckaycoppins: Former aides say they’ve heard Trump privately ridicule conservative religious leaders, dismiss faith groups with cartoonish stereotypes, and deride rites and doctrines held sacred by many in his base.

My story on what Trump really thinks about religion: https://t.co/T8UyQ5bprr
